segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4
2. Walking
20. A Meal-allocator

segments.pli: “Catūhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhattuddesako yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
segments.en: “Mendicants, a meal-allocator who has four qualities is cast down to hell.
What four?

segments.pli: Chandāgatiṃ gacchati, dosāgatiṃ gacchati, mohāgatiṃ gacchati, bhayāgatiṃ gacchati—
segments.en: They make decisions prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice.

segments.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato bhattuddesako yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
segments.en: A meal-allocator who has these four qualities is cast down to hell.

segments.pli: Catūhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhattuddesako yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge.
segments.en: A meal-allocator who has four qualities is raised up to heaven.
What four?

segments.pli: Na chandāgatiṃ gacchati, na dosāgatiṃ gacchati, na mohāgatiṃ gacchati, na bhayāgatiṃ gacchati—
segments.en: They make decisions unprejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice.

segments.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato bhattuddesako yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ saggeti.
segments.en: A meal-allocator who has these four qualities is raised up to heaven.
All those people with uncontrolled sensuality,
unprincipled, with no respect for principle,

segments.pli: Chandā dosā mohā ca bhayā gāmino,
segments.en: led astray by favoritism, hatred, stupidity, or cowardice,
are called ‘an assembly of the dregs’:
that’s what was said by the ascetic who knows.
And so those good, praiseworthy people,

segments.pli: Dhamme ṭhitā ye na karonti pāpakaṃ,
segments.en: standing on principle, doing nothing wrong,

segments.pli: Na chandā na dosā na mohā na bhayā ca gāmino;
segments.en: not led astray by favoritism, hatred, stupidity, or cowardice,
are called ‘an assembly of the cream’:
that’s what was said by the ascetic who knows.”
